episode_summary: A live-show compilation episode of No Such Thing As A Fish featuring a string of audience anecdotes and trivia from the hosts, including stories about a supposed 'soft rock' pillow that turned out to be a cow-pat, New York's nunchuck ban, an elderly Mount Everest climber, and a curious Norwegian military underwear rule.

facts.fact: So in 1974, nunchucks were banned in New York. But basically, this ban lasted for more than 40 years, and it was struck down in 2018.

So he took everyone to the field that he fell asleep in and he went, "There, there's the soft rock." And what they discovered was, it was a hardened cow-pat that was shell-like and it just slightly dented to the shape of his head when he laid on it.
He was the oldest person in the world to climb Mount Everest. He climbed at age 70.
My fact this week is that when leaving the Norwegian military, soldiers must now hand over their used underpants and socks for the next recruit to wear.
